qas.question: Which president at Notre Dame created the College of Science?
In what year was the Notre Dame College of Science formed?
How many years long was a scientific course under Patrick Dillon at Notre Dame?
Which hall at Notre Dame contains the current College of Science?
How many undergrad students attend the College of Science at Notre Dame today?

context: The College of Science was established at the university in <a1_0>1865<a1_0/> by president <a0_0>Father Patrick Dillon<a0_0/>. Dillon's scientific courses were <a2_0>six years<a2_0/> of work, including higher-level mathematics courses. Today the college, housed in the newly built <a3_0>Jordan Hall of Science<a3_0/>, includes <a4_0>over 1,200<a4_0/> undergraduates in six departments of study – biology, chemistry, mathematics, physics, pre-professional studies, and applied and computational mathematics and statistics (ACMS) – each awarding Bachelor of Science (B.S.) degrees. According to university statistics, its science pre-professional program has one of the highest acceptance rates to medical school of any university in the United States.
